job_text: ['', ' Use predictive modeling', 'Summary', ' Familiar with the following software/tools:', ' Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.', ' Excellent organizational skills', ' Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, etc.', ' Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.', 'Data Scientist', ' Must be a U.S. citizen Bachelor’s Degree 5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models Familiar with the following software/tools: Coding knowledge and experience with several languages: C, C++, Java, o JavaScript, etc. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, etc. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience with distributed data/computing tools Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders Strong problem-solving skills Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques Excellent organizational skills', ' Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders', ' Experience with distributed data/computing tools', ' Strong problem-solving skills', ' Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.', ' Work with large data sets to better understand the changing worldwide geopolitical and tactical level military landscape. Use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and data tools to build and implement models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use predictive modeling Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and data tools to build and implement models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.', ' Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.', ' Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.', ' Must be a U.S. citizen', ' Experience working with and creating data architectures.', ' Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.', ' Bachelor’s Degree']

['You have sophisticated understanding of relevant      concepts in Immunology and Computational Biology.', 'You can work successfully as the bioinformatics lead in      cross-functional teams that contribute to drug and biomarker development. ', ' You have a PhD in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics,      Computational Biology or similar field, with at least 2 to 5 years of      post-doctoral experience in basic or translational research in the field      of Immunology.  You have a strong scientific publication record.  You enjoy using creative and novel informatic      approaches and datasets to bring new insights to biological problems, and      then working closely with biomarker scientists to develop those ideas      experimentally.  You have experience working with high dimensional data      (e.g. single cell sequence assays, genotype or WGS data, proteomics data,      etc.).  You have demonstrated competence in languages such as R      or Python for bioinformatics analyses.  You are intensely curious about the biology of disease      and eager to contribute to scientific efforts focused on understanding the      molecular mechanisms underlying disease etiology.  You are able to present complex results, both verbally      and in writing, to computational and non-computational audiences.  You can work successfully as the bioinformatics lead in      cross-functional teams that contribute to drug and biomarker development.  ', 'You have experience working with high dimensional data      (e.g. single cell sequence assays, genotype or WGS data, proteomics data,      etc.). ', 'O', 'We are seeking a talented and highly motivated Bioinformatics Scientist / Senior Scientist to lead our internal bioinformatics strategy. The candidate will initially focus on Immunological diseases such as Inflammatory Bowel Disease or COPD and translate complex molecular data into insights on disease heterogeneity and mechanism of action of our therapeutics. The position is expected to evolve to a broader strategic role in alignment with the expected growing needs of the portfolio. The candidate will work closely with the Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department in Research. \xa0 ', ' You have sophisticated understanding of relevant      concepts in Immunology and Computational Biology.', 'You have demonstrated experience directing scientists      (e.g., PhD students, post-docs, scientists or other researchers in an      industry setting) who each work independently on a diverse set of research      projects. You also have demonstrated ability to direct the scientific and      professional development of such scientists. ', 'The successful candidate will join our dynamic team and lead computational biology efforts that advance personalized healthcare in areas of immunological disorders, such as IBD or COPD. The candidate will support our disease biomarker strategies, leading data analysis efforts for internal studies and external collaborations relating to understanding clinical aspects of disease through genetics, transcriptomics, and other biomarker data across clinical data sets. Success in these responsibilities requires a thorough understanding of disease and drug target biology, creativity and attention to detail, and experience in integrating biomarkers into clinical trials. Candidates with experience in exome and genome sequencing, bulk or single-cell RNA sequencing, bioinformatics, or data algorithms including machine learning will be given preference. A successful candidate will work with interdisciplinary teams including discovery research, biomarker, clinical, biostatistics, and bioinformatics scientists, and will carry out data analysis and integration across various domains. Regular publication of scientific or methodological papers is an important component of this position. Success critically depends on an ability to effectively present complex techniques and results in a clear and concise manner to a diverse audience of scientists. ', 'Senior Scientist level', 'SCIENTIST / SENIOR SCIENTIST, BIOINFORMATICS   ', 'N', 'The OMNI-Biomarker Development department at Genentech provides translational science support to inform the clinical development of novel personalized therapeutics in disease areas of Ophthalmology, Metabolism, Neuroscience, Immunology and Infectious Diseases (OMNI). Our biomarker strategies are designed to study the molecular pathways driving the disease and to establish the mechanism of action of our therapeutics. We focus on prognostic, predictive and pharmacodynamic biomarkers to enable our vision of “the right drug for the right patient at the right dose”. ', 'You have demonstrated competence in languages such as R      or Python for bioinformatics analyses. ', '\xa0 ', 'You have a PhD in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics,      Computational Biology or similar field, with at least 2 to 5 years of      post-doctoral experience in basic or translational research in the field      of Immunology. ', 'You are intensely curious about the biology of disease      and eager to contribute to scientific efforts focused on understanding the      molecular mechanisms underlying disease etiology. ['', 'The candidate will be expected to make progress on an ambitious research agenda utilizing cutting-edge machine learning methods. ', 'He or she should have a strong computational background and programming skills, as well as excellent communication skills.', 'Requirements', 'The candidate for this FireEye Data Science project is a PhD or Masters student involved in ongoing research at the intersection of machine learning and computer security. ', 'The candidate should have previous experience working on advanced research projects with typical tools used in the academic and industrial research community, such as LaTeX and GitHub. The candidate will gain valuable exposure to these new technologies and problem areas, but also build their C.V. with tangible outcomes, like peer-reviewed publications and presentations.', 'The ideal candidate for the position will be a self-motivated individual with the ability to both understand deeply complex technical concepts and to communicate those concepts to a broad team of machine learning and computer security experts, both in written and verbal form. ', 'Job Description', 'In past years, research interns have worked on projects including adversarial attacks on machine learning, generating synthetic social media content to study and detect disinformation campaigns, and using metric learning methods to quantify similarity across binaries. These projects have resulted in presentations at USENIX ScAINet, BlackHat USA, and the AAAI Symposium, along with papers to several peer-reviewed venues.', 'In past years, research interns have worked on projects including adversarial attacks on machine learning, generating synthetic social media content to study and detect disinformation campaigns, and using metric learning methods to quantify similarity across binaries. These projects have resulted in presentations at USENIX ScAINet, BlackHat USA, and the AAAI Symposium, along with papers to several peer-reviewed venues.The ideal candidate for the position will be a self-motivated individual with the ability to both understand deeply complex technical concepts and to communicate those concepts to a broad team of machine learning and computer security experts, both in written and verbal form. The candidate should have previous experience working on advanced research projects with typical tools used in the academic and industrial research community, such as LaTeX and GitHub. The candidate will gain valuable exposure to these new technologies and problem areas, but also build their C.V. with tangible outcomes, like peer-reviewed publications and presentations.', 'Company Description', 'The candidate for this FireEye Data Science project is a PhD or Masters student involved in ongoing research at the intersection of machine learning and computer security. The candidate will be expected to make progress on an ambitious research agenda utilizing cutting-edge machine learning methods. He or she should have a strong computational background and programming skills, as well as excellent communication skills.', 'Responsibilities']

['Requirements: ', 'This individual is responsible for developing strategies for Health Authority interactions, writing and reviewing sections for regulatory filings related to bioanalytical methods, immunogenicity, characterization of biological activity and data interpretation. Additionally, this individual will represent the department on cross-functional project teams, lead bioanalytical or may lead pharmacology subteams. ', 'The Senior Scientist leads the development of novel assay methods in support for Cancer ImmunoOncology biologics drug development candidates. These methods may be used to quantitate biotherapeutic levels, to detect and characterize immune responses evoked by the therapeutic, to measure biomarkers, or for biological characterization of drug candidates. This individual may lead experienced Scientists and Scientific Researchers who are actively working in the laboratory to develop a range of quantitative bioanalytical methods in support of biotherapeutics. The Senior Scientist will ensure the use of best practices including utilization of cutting-edge technology platforms, adoption of standardized practices by having a thorough understanding of relevant regulatory guidance and associated white papers, be familiar with automation systems as applicable, as well as, statistically based experimental design, in a safe working environment. ', '', 'The Senior Scientist is a highly motivated senior-level scientist who leads the development, evaluation and implementation of state-of-the-art quantitative bioanalytical PK/ADA/soluble biomarker methods, and defines immunogenicity strategies and guides data interpretation to support biopharmaceuticals in the Cancer ImmunoOncology product development pipeline at Genentech. ', ' ', 'Requirements:', 'A strong background in immunology, immunochemistry, biochemistry, cellular or molecular biology is also required, along with a track record of solving complex biological problems. This individual must have excellent interpersonal and both oral and written communication skills, along with an extensive track record of successfully developing bioanalytical methods and designing immunogenicity strategy for Cancer ImmunoOncology biopharmaceuticals. Familiarity with regulatory agency interactions is essential. This individual should have demonstrated the ability to think strategically, anticipate and identify key issues, facilitate problem solving and resolution. This individual should also have the ability to influence those who do not directly report to them through a combination of effective participation in, and leadership of teams. Experience in cancer immunoOncology drug development and knowledge in immunogenicity interpretation is highly desired.', 'A Ph.D. in Biochemistry, Immunology, or Cell Biology or a related field and extensive postdoctoral and industrial experience in bioanalytical aspects of biopharmaceutical development are required. ', 'This individual is expected to be a mentor for a recognized area of technical expertise within the department, and may be involved with assessment and implementation of new bioanalytical technologies, methods and immunogenicity strategies to meet the needs of an evolving Cancer ImmunoOncology portfolio that may include novel molecular entities and modalities. This individual may also be asked to lead technical teams or initiatives. A Senior Scientist typically manages a highly productive group of more junior staff. This will include proactive management of the scientific output of reports, and mentoring career development, along with strategic guidance and effective resource capacity management. ']

['', 'Our Core Lab has an automated line for receiving, centrifuging, routing, testing, and storage of lab specimens. Total automation has allowed more efficient use of our technologist time to concentrate on those duties that require their professional expertise, such as quality improvement processes and high complexity testing.', 'Job Purpose Or Mission', 'Our laboratory consist of both Medical Technologist and Medical Laboratory Technicians both of whom are certified by and accrediting agency and licensed by the State of Louisiana. Technologists work as a team in multiple areas such as: Blood Bank, Chemistry, Coagulation, Hematology, Microbiology, Serology, and Urinalysis. Technologists have the opportunity to apply a broad range of lab expertise and gain invaluable experience as a generalist.', 'Educational Opportunities within the first year of employment include: ', 'Education & Experience Requirements', 'Performs routine and special clinical laboratory tests on patient specimens, correlates and interprets data based on knowledge of techniques, principles and instruments. Investigates problems, performs corrective and preventive maintenance of equipment, prepares reagents, and performs data entry of test results. Responsibilities include applying clinical laboratory techniques in accordance with standardized methodology. ']

['', 'Overview', 'Ensures solutions are scalable, repeatable, efficient and effective.', 'Partner closely with business and technical teams to understand their project objectives and provide data-driven solutions and recommendations. Ability to sift through large amounts of information, extract the key insights, and communicate succinctly at all levels of leadership. ['', 'Understanding of RF physics, including principles of RF propagation. Understanding of RF antenna applications, ground-based or airborne radar applications, and RF receiver systems.', ' We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.', 'Understanding of complex signal analysis of quadrature signals, IQ data or IQ samples, and complex RF signal modulation and demodulation.', 'These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have', 'Fluency in Microsoft Office products, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.', 'Experience with scientific/engineering/statistical analysis and programming environments including experience with Python, Mathworks Matlab, National Instruments LabView, or R.', 'Familiarity with USAF and DoD EW mission areas, particularly with regard to offensive and defensive applications on military aerospace vehicles.', 'RF signals data analysis experience, including preparation of a data analysis plan.', ' For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.', 'Must have at least a SECRET level clearance to start and be able to obtain a Top Secret clearance.', 'Job Description', ' We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.', 'Support execution of HITL demonstration events. The RF signals analyst is charged with supporting execution of demonstration events in their portfolio, ensuring demonstration reporting objectives are accomplished, and supporting identification of EW system capability shortfalls. The RF signals analyst will become familiar with operational aspects of HITL simulation systems, as well as understanding how these systems affect the signal environment presented to the EW systems under demonstration. The RF Engineer will support the operation of AF laboratory signal generation and data collection systems.', 'Support development of HITL simulation scenarios for execution in the AF laboratory or customer-housed, government-furnished simulator systems. The RF signals analyst will become familiar with laboratory simulator system technical capabilities and limitations, and how these systems can be applied to the customer problem set. This role also requires understanding emitters in the RF signal environment, including friendly, neutral, and adversary radar systems, civilian and military non-radar signals present in RF background environments, and other interfering signal sources such as onboard RF communications systems and onboard jammers.', 'Familiarity with operation of RF signal generators and measurement equipment such as spectrum analyzers and oscilloscopes.', ' Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.', 'Interface with EW system program stakeholders (e.g., government program offices, system developers, operational users) to understand system demonstration technical objectives, HITL simulation scenarios, system assessment performance measures, and assessment reporting objectives.', 'Lead data analysis and reporting on laboratory demonstration events. The RF signals analyst is charged with providing system assessment reports, independent of program sponsors and systems development teams. These reports must address stakeholder technical objectives and characterize system capabilities and risk areas. The RF signals analyst is charged with conducting data analysis and when required organizing data analysis efforts to be executed by supporting team members. Assessment reports typically include textual explanations, data tables, data charts, and supporting visual images. These reports document progress toward achieving technical objectives or highlight notable technical risk areas.', 'Job Location', '4-7 years of relevant experience', 'What We Can Offer You', 'Master’s Degree in suitable technical field', 'What You’ll Get To Do', 'You’ll Bring These Qualifications', ' We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.', 'Familiarity with US intelligence community reports, documentation, and databases applied to RF EW mission areas.']
